reviewText: As others have listed there are seven (7) Herman's Hermits songs on this DVD.  The songs are as enjoyable as ever, but I didn't especially care for the comedy routine between songs.  This DVD is from a "60's Pop Rock Reunion" program that featured a number of 1960's rock groups on PBS a couple of years ago that was just simply fantastic.  However, the only way to get the DVD of that program was to pledge a couple of hundred dollars for the DVD (I did).  At this time it is not available for sale to the general public.  If you enjoy Herman's Hermits you will enjoy this DVD.  I just wish it was longer and included more of their songs.

reviewText: I bought four of these, all with the exact same two defects: A stall and skip marred "Both Sides Now", same thing with"Turn, Turn, Turn".The stall/skip is relatively late in "Both Sides Now", much earlier in "Turn, Turn, Turn".Perhaps this defect remains, or it could finally be gone.  Please let me know either way, customer to customer, by commenting upon this review, perhaps writing your own.  I'm waiting for a pre-watched, perfect Judy Collins DVD, which Amazon is unlikely to provide.  And I don't feel lucky after four bad ones.I never understood the lack of earlier reviews calling out these unacceptable defects, clear manufacturer errors.Amazon's "Rule of 2" required me to purchase two more of these defective DVDs directly from Amazon.com.  My earlier pair of purchases from Amazon Marketplace Sellers fail to count under the "Rule of 2", a dumb policy Amazon ought to change.  That's why I had to buy a quartet of identically defective Judy Collins DVDs.So discs 3 and 4 enabled me to finally satisfy Amazon's "Rule of 2".  This meant the Judy Collins DVD became an "Item Under Review".  What such "review" consisted of is any body's guess, since it's being sold again.  I can't find out a thing due to "The Amazon Rule Against Direct Communication With Customers".  I desire to learn which Amazon employee, if any, actually watched/listened to "Both Sides Now", plus "Turn, Turn, Turn", and found them to play flawlessly.  If so I deserve that disc as a gift for all my trouble, since Amazon refuses to sell anything that's been opened.  (These are still more silly, unpublished, Amazon rules that hurt customers.  No way am I getting a fifth defective disc, just like the prior four.)If nobody even played those songs, under what I call "the Amazon rule against ever watching a DVD/Blu-ray), then the same two defects probably still remain.By the way, it's a great Judy Collins performance, except for the defects which wreck this DVD, four times already for me.
summary: Is this Judy Collins Concert DVD Still Defective?
Title: N/A

reviewText: Peter Noone has some really great songs.  He is getting up in years, but still puts on a GREAT show.  I have been to three of his concerts in person, and this is the "next best thing".  The quality of this DVD is perfect.  Any Herman's Hermits fans will not be disappointed with this DVD.  Songs include:  I'm into Something Good; (What a) Wonderful World; Listen People; Can't You Hear my Heartbeat; Mrs. Brown You've Got a Lovely Daughter; I'm Henry the VIII, I am; and There's a Kind of Hush.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just received and viewed my copy of this DVD and wanted to share some thoughts on it. Here are some Pro's and Con's:Cons----* The cover says "Performing Live: 9 Classic Hits". There are only 7 Herman's Hermits songs on this (as listed on the first review below & the "Editorial Reviews" above). I can only assume they are adding the comedy bits (i.e.: Mick Jagger, Davy Jones, Johnny Cash) where he mocks a few songs.* When I read "Herman's Hermits starring Peter Noone", I assumed that I would at least see a few of the original members in the band. There are none. I've seen Peter Noone live in concert and he usually performs only as himself (there is a separate DVD that came out that lists only him). A few of his old original bandmates do still perform (I have also seen them live), so that was a bit disappointing.* Only 45 minutes for $13.49. Should have been sold for a little less ($9.99 or $10.99??).Pros----* Audio and Video are excellant. 4.5 Audio/4.5 Video. Great picture quality but venue lighting was so-so.* Peter Noone's voice is in great shape. Can still hit the highs and also very youthful sounding.* He is a wonderful entertainer (musically, comically & animated). Although you only get 7 true songs (approximately 20 minutes in total), you get some comedy bits and audience interaction in between that expand the set to 45 minutes. Peter is still very witty.I'm very happy with the purchase. I believe most early 60's music fans will agree.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this DVD because it has some of her later work that is not often demonstrated on film.  Ms. Collins has reached the time when the voice begins to deteriorate from the excellence of youth, but she still has excellent clarity and very good control.  This DVD is not as good as the Wolf Trap show, but it is an acceptable addition to your DVD performance library, especially if you prefer to listen to people who can actually sing, which is getting harder and harder to find these days.

reviewText: Peter Noone is a classic act.Both in music,and comedy.This is a good DVD as far as seeing him how he performs now compared to back in the 60's.Even though the DVD is about ten years old.It is a pretty good look on how he performs today.I saw him about a year and a half ago or so,and he was much like this DVD.I wish the DVD could have been longer.But,it's still a great treasure to me.It came a day before expected.Really enjoying it.
